4701.definition: [σπορά] from {{G4687}}; a sowing, i.e. (by implication) parentage

4702.definition: [σπόριμος] from {{G4703}}; sown, i.e. (neuter plural) a planted field

4703.definition: [σπόρος] from {{G4687}}; a scattering (of seed), i.e. (concretely) seed (as sown)

4704.definition: [σπουδάζω] from {{G4710}}; to use speed, i.e. to make effort, be prompt or earnest

4706.definition: [σπουδαιότερον] neuter of {{G4707}} as adverb; more earnestly than others), i.e. very promptly

4707.definition: [σπουδαιότερος] comparative of {{G4705}}; more prompt, more earnest

4708.definition: [σπουδαιοτέρως] adverb from {{G4707}}; more speedily, i.e. sooner than otherwise

4710.definition: [σπουδή] from {{G4692}}; "speed", i.e. (by implication) despatch, eagerness, earnestness

4711.definition: [σπυρίς] from {{G4687}} (as woven); a hamper or lunch-receptacle

4712.definition: [στάδιον] , or masculine (in plural)      στάδιοςfrom the base of {{G2476}} (as fixed); a stade or certain measure of distance; by implication, a stadium or race-course

4713.definition: [στάμνος] from the base of {{G2476}} (as stationary); a jar or earthen tank

4714.definition: [στάσις] from the base of {{G2476}}; a standing (properly, the act), i.e. (by analogy) position (existence); by implication, a popular uprising; figuratively, controversy

4715.definition: [στατήρ] from the base of {{G2746}}; a stander (standard of value), i.e. (specially), a stater or certain coin

4716.definition: [σταυρός] from the base of {{G2476}}; a stake or post (as set upright), i.e. (specially), a pole or cross (as an instrument of capital punishment); figuratively, exposure to death, i.e. self-denial; by implication, the atonement of Christ

4717.definition: [σταυρόω] from {{G4716}}; to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish (subdue) passion or selfishness

4718.definition: [σταφυλή] probably from the base of {{G4735}}; a cluster of grapes (as if intertwined)

4719.definition: [στάχυς] from the base of {{G2476}}; a head of grain (as standing out from the stalk)

4720.definition: [Στάχυς] the same as {{G4719}}; Stachys, a Christian

4721.definition: [στέγη] strengthened from a primary τέγος (a "thatch" or "deck" of a building); a roof

4722.definition: [στέγω] from {{G4721}}; to roof over, i.e. (figuratively) to cover with silence (endure patiently)

4723.definition: [στείρος] a contraction from {{G4731}} (as stiff and unnatural); "sterile"

4724.definition: [στέλλω] probably strengthened from the base of {{G2476}}; properly, to set fast ("stall"), i.e. (figuratively) to repress (reflexively, abstain from associating with)

4725.definition: [στέμμα] from the base of {{G4735}}; a wreath for show

4727.definition: [στενάζω] from {{G4728}}; to make (intransitively, be) in straits, i.e. (by implication) to sigh, murmur, pray inaudibly

4728.definition: [στενός] probably from the base of {{G2476}}; narrow (from obstacles standing close about)

4729.definition: [στενοχωρέω] from the same as {{G4730}}; to hem in closely, i.e. (figuratively) cramp

4730.definition: [στενοχωρία] from a compound of {{G4728}} and {{G5561}}; narrowness of room, i.e. (figuratively) calamity

4731.definition: [στερεός] from {{G2476}}; stiff, i.e. solid, stable (literally or figuratively)

4732.definition: [στερεόω] from {{G4731}}; to solidify, i.e. confirm (literally or figuratively)

4734.definition: [Στεφανᾶς] probably contraction for στεφανωτός (crowned; from {{G4737}}); Stephanas, a Christian

4735.definition: [στέφανος] from an apparently primary στέφω (to twine or wreathe); a chaplet (as a badge of royalty, a prize in the public games or a symbol of honor generally; but more conspicuous and elaborate than the simple fillet, {{G1238}}), literally or figuratively

4736.definition: [Στέφανος] the same as {{G4735}}; Stephanus, a Christian

4737.definition: [στεφανόω] from {{G4735}}; to adorn with an honorary wreath (literally or figuratively)

4738.definition: [στῆθος] from {{G2476}} (as standing prominently); the (entire external) bosom, i.e. chest

4739.definition: [στήκω] from the perfect tense of {{G2476}}; to be stationary, i.e. (figuratively) to persevere

4741.definition: [στηρίζω] from a presumed derivative of {{G2476}} (like {{G4731}}); to set fast, i.e. (literally) to turn resolutely in a certain direction, or (figuratively) to confirm

4742.definition: [στίγμα] from a primary στίζω (to "stick", i.e. prick); a mark incised or punched (for recognition of ownership), i.e. (figuratively) scar of service

4743.definition: [στιγμή] feminine of {{G4742}}; a point of time, i.e. an instant

4744.definition: [στίλβω] apparently a primary verb; to gleam, i.e. flash intensely

4745.definition: [στοά] probably from {{G2476}}; a colonnade or interior piazza

4746.definition: [στοιβάς] from a primary στείβω (to "step" or "stamp"); a spread (as if tramped flat) of loose materials for a couch, i.e. (by implication) a bough of a tree so employed

4747.definition: [στοιχεῖον] neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of {{G4748}}; something orderly in arrangement, i.e. (by implication) a serial (basal, fundamental, initial) constituent (literally), proposition (figuratively)

4748.definition: [στοιχέω] from a derivative of στείχω (to range in regular line); to march in (military) rank (keep step), i.e. (figuratively) to conform to virtue and piety

4749.definition: [στολή] from {{G4724}}; equipment, i.e. (specially), a "stole" or long-fitting gown (as a mark of dignity)

4750.definition: [στόμα] probably strengthened from a presumed derivative of the base of {{G5114}}; the mouth (as if a gash in the face); by implication, language (and its relations); figuratively, an opening (in the earth); specially, the front or edge (of a weapon)

4751.definition: [στόμαχος] from {{G4750}}; an orifice (the gullet), i.e. (specially), the "stomach"

4752.definition: [στρατεία] from {{G4754}}; military service, i.e. (figuratively) the apostolic career (as one of hardship and danger)

4753.definition: [στράτευμα] from {{G4754}}; an armament, i.e. (by implication) a body of troops (more or less extensive or systematic)

4754.definition: [στρατεύομαι] middle voice from the base of {{G4756}}; to serve in a military campaign; figuratively, to execute the apostolate (with its arduous duties and functions), to contend with carnal inclinations

4755.definition: [στρατηγός] from the base of {{G4756}} and {{G71}} or {{G2233}}; a general, i.e. (by implication or analogy) a (military) governor (prætor), the chief (præfect) of the (Levitical) temple-wardens

4756.definition: [στρατιά] feminine of a derivative of στρατός (an army; from the base of {{G4766}}, as encamped); camp-likeness, i.e. an army, i.e. (figuratively) the angels, the celestial luminaries

4757.definition: [στρατιώτης] from a presumed derivative of the same as {{G4756}}; a camper-out, i.e. a (common) warrior (literally or figuratively)

4758.definition: [στρατολογέω] from a compound of the base of {{G4756}} and {{G3004}} (in its original sense); to gather (or select) as a warrior, i.e. enlist in the army

4759.definition: [στρατοπεδάρχης] from {{G4760}} and {{G757}}; a ruler of an army, i.e. (specially), a Prætorian præfect

4760.definition: [στρατόπεδον] from the base of {{G4756}} and the same as {{G3977}}; a camping-ground, i.e. (by implication) a body of troops

4761.definition: [στρεβλόω] from a derivative of {{G4762}}; to wrench, i.e. (specially), to torture (by the rack), but only figuratively, to pervert

4762.definition: [στρέφω] strengthened from the base of {{G5157}}; to twist, i.e. turn quite around or reverse (literally or figuratively)

4763.definition: [στρηνιάω] from a presumed derivative of {{G4764}}; to be luxurious

4764.definition: [στρῆνος] akin to {{G4731}}; a "straining", "strenuousness" or "strength", i.e. (figuratively) luxury (voluptuousness)

4765.definition: [στρουθίον] diminutive of στρουθός (a sparrow); a little sparrow

4766.definition: [στρώννυμι] ,  or simpler      στρωννύω; prolongation from a still simpler      στρόω, (used only as an alternate in certain tenses) (probably akin to {{G4731}} through the idea of positing); to "strew," i.e. spread (as a carpet or couch)

4767.definition: [στυγνητός] from a derivative of an obsolete apparently primary στύγω (to hate); hated, i.e. odious

4768.definition: [στυγνάζω] from the same as {{G4767}}; to render gloomy, i.e. (by implication) glower (be overcast with clouds, or sombreness of speech)

4769.definition: [στῦλος] from στύω (to stiffen; properly akin to the base of {{G2476}}); a post ("style"), i.e. (figuratively) support

4770.definition: [Στωϊκός] from {{G4745}}; a "Stoic" (as occupying a particular porch in Athens), i.e. adherent of a certin philosophy

4771.definition: [σύ] the personal pronoun of the second person singular; thou See also {{G4571}}, {{G4671}}, {{G4675}}; and for the plural {{G5209}}, {{G5210}}, {{G5213}}, {{G5216}}.

4773.definition: [συγγενής] from {{G4862}} and {{G1085}}; a relative (by blood); by extension, a fellow countryman

4774.definition: [συγγνώμη] from a compound of {{G4862}} and {{G1097}}; fellow knowledge, i.e. concession

4775.definition: [συγκάθημαι] from {{G4862}} and {{G2521}}; to seat oneself in company with

4776.definition: [συγκαθίζω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2523}}; to give (or take) a seat in company with

4777.definition: [συγκακοπαθέω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2553}}; to suffer hardship in company with

4778.definition: [συγκακουχέω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2558}}; to maltreat in company with, i.e. (passively) endure persecution together

4781.definition: [συγκάμπτω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2578}}; to bend together, i.e. (figuratively) to afflict

4782.definition: [συγκαταβαίνω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2597}}; to descend in company with

4783.definition: [συγκατάθεσις] from {{G4784}}; a deposition (of sentiment) in company with, i.e. (figuratively) accord with

4784.definition: [συγκατατίθεμαι] middle from {{G4862}} and {{G2698}}; to deposit (one's vote or opinion) in company with, i.e. (figuratively) to accord with

4785.definition: [συγκαταψηφίζω] from {{G4862}} and a compound of {{G2596}} and {{G5585}}; to count down in company with, i.e. enroll among

4786.definition: [συγκεράννυμι] from {{G4862}} and {{G2767}}; to commingle, i.e. (figuratively) to combine or assimilate

4787.definition: [συγκινέω] from {{G4682}} and {{G2795}}; to move together, i.e. (specially), to excite as a mass (to sedition)

4788.definition: [συγκλείω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2808}}; to shut together, i.e. include or (figuratively) embrace in a common subjection to

4789.definition: [συγκληρονόμος] from {{G4862}} and {{G2818}}; a co-heir, i.e. (by analogy) participant in common

4790.definition: [συγκοινωνέω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2841}}; to share in company with, i.e. co-participate in

4792.definition: [συγκομίζω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2865}}; to convey together, i.e. collect or bear away in company with others

4793.definition: [συγκρίνω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2919}}; to judge of one thing in connection with another, i.e. combine (spiritual ideas with appropriate expressions) or collate (one person with another by way of contrast or resemblance)

4794.definition: [συγκύπτω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2955}}; to stoop altogether, i.e. be completely overcome by

4795.definition: [συγκυρία] from a comparative of {{G4862}} and κυρέω (to light or happen; from the base of {{G2962}}); concurrence, i.e. accident

4796.definition: [συγχαίρω] from {{G4862}} and {{G5463}}; to sympathize in gladness, congratulate

4797.definition: [συγχέω]   or συγχύνωfrom {{G4862}} and χέω (to pour) or its alternate; to commingle promiscuously, i.e. (figuratively) to throw (an assembly) into disorder, to perplex (the mind)

4798.definition: [συγχράομαι] from {{G4862}} and {{G5530}}; to use jointly, i.e. (by implication) to hold intercourse in common

4800.definition: [συζάω] from {{G4862}} and {{G2198}}; to continue to live in common with, i.e. co-survive (literally or figuratively)
